channel.title: Input Signal Out of Range
channel.description: Okay, in Ubuntu 11.04 I get an error kind of message upon reboot. It didn't happen in the last Ubuntu release... But w\e, when I reboot my computer, it shows a message "Input Signal Out of Range Change Settings to 1920x180 60hz." In my monitor changing settings in Ubuntu, it doesn't have the option 60hz; it only has 50 and 51. I have to pound on the enter key for everything to load up. Any help please?

item.title: Input Signal Out of Range
item.dc:creator: @sageofmali sageofmali
item.description:
@sageofmali wrote:

zyle1992:

The most probably cause is that with the drivers that come with Ubuntu, the monitor can’t go to the max resolution handled by the card/monitor. You might need to install the restricted/proprietary drivers.

There aren’t any other drivers, other than the one I’m using.

Read full topic

item.description:
@zyle1992 wrote:

item.description:
@sageofmali wrote:

Loveandpower:

Isn’t 11.04 still in like Beta stages seems like they are trying to advance technology as well. -/

Eh, it’s almost out of beta… But, I didn’t have this problem in the last version.
